doc.title: Transsion (A)
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA/Transsion A 2Q miss rising RD to drive high-end but time needed for monetization NeutralTranssion A 2Q miss rising RD to_2025-08-28

processing_metadata.publication: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA
processing_metadata.input_relative_path: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA

passages.text: Reiterate Rating: NEUTRAL | PO: 86.00 CNY | Price: 83.59 CNY

Transsion's 2Q earnings missed BofA/consensus by \(35\% /42\%\) at CNY723mn (+48% QoQ, - 41% YoY). Sales of CNY16bn (+24% QoQ, - 6% YoY) came largely in line with BofA/ consensus, while GM was 0.3ppt better than our expectation at \(20.8\% (+1.5\) ppt QoQ) despite memory price hike. The slower earnings were mainly due to higher R&D expenses (opex ratio at \(15.4\%\) , R&D ratio at \(4.9\%\) vs. \(3.5\%\) in 2Q24 and \(4.5\%\) in 1Q25). In 1H, Africa/South Asia/other new markets contributed \(40\% /16\% /44\%\) of total smartphone shipment. Shipment in Africa grew \(3\%\) YoY while other markets saw YoY decline.

We note the QoQ GM expansion in 2Q was a result of new model launches and less inventory burden. Mgmt. aims to drive more shipment in the mid- to- high- end market, leading to higher R&D expenses in 2Q. Mgmt. noted it is doing more upgrades at thermal (for gaming), camera, and also AI functions to improve user experience and to differentiate Transsion from its peers. We believe this will help lift blended ASP and support GM in the long term, but also note Transsion may face more competitors in the mid- to- high- end segment, especially among China brands. We thus believe monetization will take time, and near- term operating margin pressure seems inevitable.

We cut our 2025- 27E earnings by \(2 - 9\%\) to reflect the results and potential opex burden. We maintain our PO at CNY86 (20x 2H25- 1H26E P/E, unchanged). The stock trades at 21x 2025- 26E P/E, around its historical trading avg. We reiterate Neutral on fair valuation.

Company DescriptionTransition is Africa's largest mobile brand and number- 1 feature phone vendor globally. It is witnessing smartphone migration cycle in emerging markets like Middle East and Africa/SE Asia. It also extends business into IoT, home appliance and internet. These business offer long- term value and should grow with rising smartphone penetration, increasing access to electricity and network upgrade to 3G/4G and even 5G in emerging markets.

Investment RationaleWe have a Neutral rating on Transsion on balanced risk- reward. We expect increasing competition in emerging markets, but see margin concern is easing following declining component cost and potentially easing dollar. Meanwhile, long- term growth outlook remains positive on rising smartphone penetration and mobile network upgrade to 4G/5G in emerging markets.
Source: Company data, BofA Global Research estimates, Bloomberg consensus
Exhibit 2: Earnings estimate change,2025-27E We trim 2025-27E earnings by \(2 - 9\%\)
Source: BofA Global Research estimates
Exhibit 3: BofA ve s consensus, 2025-27E Our 2025E earnings are \(27\%\) below consensus, and largely in line with consensus for 2026-27E
Source: BofA Global Research estimates, Bloomberg consensus
Exhibit 4:Transsion's quarterly income statement,2024-27E We model \(4\%\) earnings growth in 2024-27E
Exhibit 4:Transsion's quarterly income statement,2024-27E We model 4% earnings growth in 2024-27E
Source: Company data, BofA Global Research estimates

We set our PO at CNY86, on 20x 2H25- 1H26E P/E. We believe 20x (slightly below the 22x historical 4- year average) is reasonable given stable shipment expansion in emerging markets while reflects margin risk amid competition. We match our 20x to Transsion's trading multiple in 1H22 when earnings started to weaken after three years' strong growth.

Downside risks: (1) slower- than- expected smartphone shipment, (2) intensifying competition from China brands in Africa, (3) worsening margin profile due to extensive promotion/marketing for new markets
Upside risks: (1) faster- than- expected smartphone shipment, (2) less competition from China brands in Africa and SE Asia, (3) stronger margin profile
